content: @Eric Huss in our meeting mentioned that he was more aggressively using "want help" tags, in the hope that the "somebody" store may make a delivery. Witch tags are you using? And Is there a low effort way for recently added items to end up in TWIR?

Any of the E- tags indicate something should get fixed.

I'm not sure what the process is for adding to TWIR, I think you have to make a PR to their repo.
Ok, I can talk to them. If needed I can make a PR once a week for all things that have bean labeled E-* in the past week.

The script I came up with outputted:
feature: default-run included in cargo metadata
Detect incorrectly named cargo.toml
check --tests always succeeds if you have test = false in Cargo.toml
Can't publish from workspace root, no -p option
Prioritize [patch] versions the way we do for versions in the lockfile
error: failed to select a version for hidapi.
Specifying jobs = 0 in .cargo/config hangs cargo forever without output
If that looks like a good list, I will submit it for TWIR.
I would also check if issues aren't claimed. And it looks like the bot on rust-lang/cargo#9497 didn't work, might be good to figure out why that is.
Looks like it has never worked, I'll ping infra.

So manually filtering for ones that are unclaimed:
Prioritize [patch] versions the way we do for versions in the lockfile
error: failed to select a version for hidapi.
Specifying jobs = 0 in .cargo/config hangs cargo forever without output
Looks like the tags work well, even before publicity!

The only thing labeled E- this week is:
https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/issues/9575
Is it worth putting on TWIR?

I'm ambivalent. I lean towards no, but it is something that would be nice to fix. The reason I say no is because I don't know how this could be easily fixed without spending a lot of time on it, which I think does not make for a good first issue. But if someone else wants to spend the time to help with the issue, that would be great.
Ya, I am leaning towards skipping this week.

Still need to look things over but here is the starting list:
Warn if dependency doesn't have library target kind
Ability to specify the output name for a bin target different from the crate name
Using alternative registries names in text output
A dependacy on path = "." shuld have a good error message
SearchIndexer takes time indexing \target on windows
cargo vendor does not include license-file if not in package list

So I will submit for TWIR:
Ability to specify the output name for a bin target different from the crate name
Using alternative registries names in text output
A dependacy on path = "." shuld have a good error message
SearchIndexer takes time indexing \target on windows

For TWIR this week:
"error: binary xxx already exists in destination" should print the full destination path
if no one objects.

It looks like I have forgotten to run this in a long time. oops. The list is:

Cargo should warn when "include" doesn't match any files, or filters files from parent directories
Don't do a full scan on first build
"failed to determine package fingerprint for build script" caused by a symlink pointing to an unreadable directory
cargo:rustc-link-args not applied to doctest builds
Failure to resolve a package name when used together with other packages
Cargo gets lost in the root of a Linux filesystem
cargo metadata doesn't indicate that feature-enabled transitive platform-specific deps are platform-specific

if no one objects.
